Detailed Description

Data section representing a zip file archive.

BinaryPtr ZipSection::asBinary (  )  [virtual]

This method returns the binary data owned by this section.

Returns:
Smart pointer to binary data object

Reimplemented from DataSection.

int ZipSection::bytes (  )  const [virtual]

This method returns the number of bytes used by this section.

Note that a ZipSection does not store the data, it is similar to a DirSection because it just manages its children.

Returns:
Number of bytes used by this ZipSection.

Implements DataSection.

DataSectionPtr ZipSection::convertToZip ( const std::string &  saveAs = "",
DataSectionPtr  pRoot = NULL,
std::vector< DataSectionPtr > *  children = NULL 
) [virtual]

This method converts the passed data into a zip section.

This is similar to the convertToZip method in DirSection but handles nested zip file conversion.

Returns:
The converted data section.

DataSectionPtr ZipSection::findChild ( const std::string &  tag,
DataSectionCreator *  creator = NULL 
) [virtual]

This method locates a child by name.

It first searches the cache, and returns a cached DataSection if there was one. Otherwise, it will create a new ZipSection, XmlSection, or BinSection. It will return a NULL pointer if the DataSection could not be created.

Parameters:
tag Name of the child to locate
creator DataSectionCreator used to create the new section if necessary.
Returns:
Pointer to DataSection representing the child.

Implements DataSection.

DataSectionCreator *  creator = NULL 
) [virtual]

Returns:

Implements DataSection.

index Index of the child to return.
Returns:
Pointer to the specified child.

Implements DataSection.

bool ZipSection::save ( const std::string &  saveAsFileName = ""  )  [virtual]

This method saves the section.

Zip sections don't directly save to disk, they generate a binary block representing the file and then rely on the parent section to save to the file system.

Returns:
true if successful.

Implements DataSection.

bool  isBinary
